00134          * De-register Image
00135          *
00136          * De-registers an AMI. Once de-registered, instances of the AMI may no longer be launched.
00137          *
00138          * @access public
00139          * @param string $image_id (Required) Unique ID of a machine image, returned by a call to register_image() or describe_images().
00140          * @return TarzanHTTPResponse
00141          * @see http://docs.amazonwebservices.com/AWSEC2/2007-03-01/DeveloperGuide/ApiReference-Query-DeregisterImage.html
00142          */
00143         public function deregister_image($image_id)
00144         {
00145                 if (!$opt)
00146                 {
00147                         $opt = array();
00148                 }
00149 
00150                 if ($image_id)
00151                 {
00152                         $opt['ImageId'] = $image_id;
00153                 }
00154 
00155                 return $this->authenticate('DeregisterImage', $opt, EC2_DEFAULT_URL);
00156         }

00159          * Describe Image
00160          *
00161          * Returns information about AMIs available for use by the user. This includes both public AMIs (those 
00162          * available for any user to launch) and private AMIs (those owned by the user making the request and 
00163          * those owned by other users that the user making the request has explicit launch permissions for).
00164          *
00165          * @access public
00166          * @param array $opt Associative array of parameters which can have the following keys:

00168          *   <li>string ExecutableBy.n - (Optional) Describe AMIs that the specified users have launch permissions for. Accepts Amazon account ID, 'self', or 'all' for public AMIs.</li>
00169          *   <li>string ImageId.n - (Optional) A list of image descriptions.</li>
00170          *   <li>string Owner.n - (Optional) Owners of AMIs to describe.</li>

00229                 }
00230

00232                 {
00233                         $opt['ImageId'] = $image_id;
00234                 }
00235 
00236                 // This is the only supported value in the EC2 2007-03-01 release.
00237                 $opt['Attribute'] = 'launchPermission';
00238 
00239                 return $this->authenticate('DescribeImageAttribute', $opt, EC2_DEFAULT_URL);
00240         }

00243          * Modify Image Attribute
00244          *
00245          * Modifies an attribute of an AMI.
00246          *
00247          * @access public
00248          * @param string $image_id (Required) AMI ID to modify an attribute on.
00249          * @param string $attribute (Required) Specifies the attribute to modify. Supports 'launchPermission' and 'productCodes'.
00250          * @param array $opt Associative array of parameters which can have the following keys:
00251          * <ul>
00252          *   <li>string OperationType - (Required for 'launchPermission' Attribute) Specifies the operation to perform on the attribute. Supports 'add' and 'remove'.</li>
00253          *   <li>string UserId.n - (Required for 'launchPermission' Attribute) User IDs to add to or remove from the 'launchPermission' attribute.</li>
00254          *   <li>string UserGroup.n - (Required for 'launchPermission' Attribute) User groups to add to or remove from the 'launchPermission' attribute. Currently, only the 'all' group is available, specifiying all Amazon EC2 users.</li>
00255          *   <li>string ProductCode.n - (Required for 'productCodes' Attribute) Attaches product codes to the AMI. Currently only one product code may be associated with an AMI. Once set, the product code can not be changed or reset.</li>
00256          * </ul>
00257          * @return TarzanHTTPResponse
00258          * @see http://docs.amazonwebservices.com/AWSEC2/2007-03-01/DeveloperGuide/ApiReference-Query-ModifyImageAttribute.html

00303          * Confirm Product Instance
00304          *
00305          * Returns true if the given product code is attached to the instance with the given instance id. 
00306          * The operation returns false if the product code is not attached to the instance.
00307          *
00308          * @access public
00309          * @param string $product_code (Required) The product code to confirm is attached to the instance.
00310          * @param string $instance_id (Required) The instance to confirm.
00311          * @return TarzanHTTPResponse
00312          * @see http://docs.amazonwebservices.com/AWSEC2/2007-03-01/DeveloperGuide/ApiReference-Query-ConfirmProductInstance.html
00313          */

00315         {

00318                         $opt = array();
00319                 }
00320

00322                 {
00323                         $opt['ProductCode'] = $product_code;
00324                 }
00325 
00326                 if ($instance_id)
00327                 {
00328                         $opt['InstanceId'] = $instance_id;
00329                 }
00330 
00331                 return $this->authenticate('ConfirmProductInstance', $opt, EC2_DEFAULT_URL);
00332         }

00357         /**
00358          * Run Instances
00359          *
00360          * Launches a specified number of instances. A call to RunInstances is guaranteed to start no 
00361          * fewer than the requested minimum. If there is insufficient capacity available then no 
00362          * instances will be started. Amazon EC2 will make a best effort attempt to satisfy the 
00363          * requested maximum values.
00364          *
00365          * @access public
00366          * @param string ImageId (Required) ID of the AMI to launch instances based on.
00367          * @param integer MinCount (Required) Minimum number of instances to launch.
00368          * @param integer MaxCount (Required) Maximum number of instances to launch.
00369          * @param array $opt Associative array of parameters which can have the following keys:
00370          * <ul>
00371          *   <li>string KeyName - (Optional) Name of the keypair to launch instances with.</li>
00372          *   <li>string SecurityGroup.n - (Optional) Names of the security groups to associate the instances with.</li>
00373          *   <li>string UserData - (Optional) The user data available to the launched instances. This should be base64-encoded. See the UserDataType data type for encoding details.</li>
00374          *   <li>string AddressingType - (Optional) The addressing scheme to launch the instance with. The addressing type can be direct or public. In the direct scheme the instance has one IP address that is not NAT'd. For the public scheme the instance has a NAT'd IP address. See the section called "Instance Addressing" for more information on instance addressing.</li>
00375          * </ul>
00376          * @return TarzanHTTPResponse
00377          * @see http://docs.amazonwebservices.com/AWSEC2/2007-03-01/DeveloperGuide/ApiReference-Query-RunInstances.html
00378          */
00379         public function run_instances($image_id, $min_count, $max_count, $opt = null)
00380         {
00381                 if (!$opt)
00382                 {
00383                         $opt = array();
00384                 }
00385 
00386                 if ($image_id)
00387                 {
00388                         $opt['ImageId'] = $image_id;
00389                 }
00390 
00391                 if ($min_count)
00392                 {
00393                         $opt['MinCount'] = $min_count;
00394                 }
00395 
00396                 if ($max_count)
00397                 {
00398                         $opt['MaxCount'] = $max_count;
00399                 }
00400 
00401                 return $this->authenticate('RunInstances', $opt, EC2_DEFAULT_URL);
00402         }

00510         /*%******************************************************************************************%*/
00511         // SECURITY GROUPS
00512 
00513         /**
00514          * Authorize Security Groups Ingress
00515          *
00516          * Adds permissions to a security group.
00517          * 
00518          * Permissions are specified in terms of the IP protocol (TCP, UDP or ICMP), the source of the 
00519          * request (by IP range or an Amazon EC2 user-group pair), source and destination port ranges 
00520          * (for TCP and UDP), and ICMP codes and types (for ICMP). When authorizing ICMP, -1 may be 
00521          * used as a wildcard in the type and code fields.
00522          * 
00523          * Permission changes are propagated to instances within the security group being modified as 
00524          * quickly as possible. However, a small delay is likely, depending on the number of instances 
00525          * that are members of the indicated group.
00526          * 
00527          * When authorizing a user/group pair permission, GroupName, SourceSecurityGroupName and 
00528          * SourceSecurityGroupOwnerId must be specified. When authorizing a CIDR IP permission, 
00529          * GroupName, IpProtocol, FromPort, ToPort and CidrIp must be specified. Mixing these two 
00530          * types of parameters is not allowed.
00531          *
00532          * @access public
00533          * @param string $group_name (Required) Name of the security group to modify.
00534          * @param array $opt Associative array of parameters which can have the following keys:
00535          * <ul>
00536          *   <li>string SourceSecurityGroupName - (Required when authorizing user/group pair permission) Name of security group to authorize access to when operating on a user/group pair.</li>
00537          *   <li>string SourceSecurityGroupOwnerId - (Required when authorizing user/group pair permission) Owner of security group to authorize access to when operating on a user/group pair.</li>
00538          *   <li>string IpProtocol - (Required when authorizing CIDR IP permission) IP protocol to authorize access to when operating on a CIDR IP. Valid values are 'tcp', 'udp' and 'icmp'.</li>
00539          *   <li>integer FromPort - (Required when authorizing CIDR IP permission) Bottom of port range to authorize access to when operating on a CIDR IP. This contains the ICMP type if ICMP is being authorized.</li>
00540          *   <li>integer ToPort - (Required when authorizing CIDR IP permission) Top of port range to authorize access to when operating on a CIDR IP. This contains the ICMP code if ICMP is being authorized.</li>
00541          *   <li>string CidrIp - (Required when authorizing CIDR IP permission) CIDR IP range to authorize access to when operating on a CIDR IP.</li>
00542          * </ul>
00543          * @return TarzanHTTPResponse
00544          * @see http://docs.amazonwebservices.com/AWSEC2/2007-03-01/DeveloperGuide/ApiReference-Query-AuthorizeSecurityGroupIngress.html
00545          */
00546         public function authorize_security_group_ingress($group_name, $opt = null)
00547         {
00548                 if (!$opt)
00549                 {
00550                         $opt = array();
00551                 }
00552 
00553                 if ($group_name)
00554                 {
00555                         $opt['GroupName'] = $group_name;
00556                 }
00557 
00558                 return $this->authenticate('AuthorizeSecurityGroupIngress', $opt, EC2_DEFAULT_URL);
00559         }
00560 
00561         /**
00562          * Create Security Group
00563          *
00564          * Every instance is launched in a security group. If none is specified as part of the launch request 
00565          * then instances are launched in the default security group. Instances within the same security group 
00566          * have unrestricted network access to one another. Instances will reject network access attempts from 
00567          * other instances in a different security group. As the owner of instances you may grant or revoke 
00568          * specific permissions using the AuthorizeSecurityGroupIngress and RevokeSecurityGroupIngress operations.
00569          *
00570          * @access public
00571          * @param string $group_name (Required) Name for the new security group.
00572          * @param string $group_description (Required) Description of the new security group.
00573          * @return TarzanHTTPResponse
00574          * @see http://docs.amazonwebservices.com/AWSEC2/2007-03-01/DeveloperGuide/ApiReference-Query-CreateSecurityGroup.html
00575          */
00576         public function create_security_group($group_name, $group_description)
00577         {
00578                 if (!$opt)
00579                 {
00580                         $opt = array();
00581                 }
00582 
00583                 if ($group_name)
00584                 {
00585                         $opt['GroupName'] = $group_name;
00586                 }
00587 
00588                 if ($group_description)
00589                 {
00590                         $opt['GroupDescription'] = $group_description;
00591                 }
00592 
00593                 return $this->authenticate('CreateSecurityGroup', $opt, EC2_DEFAULT_URL);
00594         }
00595 
00596         /**
00597          * Delete Security Group
00598          *
00599          * Deletes a security group. If an attempt is made to delete a security group and any instances exist 
00600          * that are members of that group a fault is returned.
00601          *
00602          * @access public
00603          * @param string $group_name (Required) Name for the new security group.
00604          * @return TarzanHTTPResponse
00605          * @see http://docs.amazonwebservices.com/AWSEC2/2007-03-01/DeveloperGuide/ApiReference-Query-DeleteSecurityGroup.html
00606          */
00607         public function delete_security_group($group_name)
00608         {
00609                 if (!$opt)
00610                 {
00611                         $opt = array();
00612                 }

00621 
00622         /**
00623          * Describe Security Groups
00624          *
00625          * Returns information about security groups owned by the user making the request. An optional list 
00626          * of security group names may be provided to request information for those security groups only. 
00627          * If no security group names are provided, information of all security groups will be returned. 
00628          * If a group is specified that does not exist a fault is returned.
00629          *
00630          * @access public
00631          * @param array $opt Associative array of parameters which can have the following keys:
00632          * <ul>
00633          *   <li>string GroupName.n - (Optional) List of security groups to describe.</li>
00634          * </ul>
00635          * @return TarzanHTTPResponse
00636          * @see http://docs.amazonwebservices.com/AWSEC2/2007-03-01/DeveloperGuide/ApiReference-Query-DescribeSecurityGroups.html
00637          */
00638         public function describe_security_groups($opt = null)
00639         {
00640                 if (!$opt)
00641                 {
00642                         $opt = array();
00643                 }
00644 
00645                 return $this->authenticate('DescribeSecurityGroups', $opt, EC2_DEFAULT_URL);
00646         }
00647 
00648         /**
00649          * Revoke Security Groups Ingress
00650          *
00651          * Revokes existing permissions that were previously granted to a security group. The permissions 
00652          * to revoke must be specified using the same values originally used to grant the permission.
00653          * 
00654          * Permissions are specified in terms of the IP protocol (TCP, UDP or ICMP), the source of the 
00655          * request (by IP range or an Amazon EC2 user-group pair), source and destination port ranges 
00656          * (for TCP and UDP), and ICMP codes and types (for ICMP). When authorizing ICMP, -1 may be 
00657          * used as a wildcard in the type and code fields.
00658          * 
00659          * Permission changes are propagated to instances within the security group being modified as 
00660          * quickly as possible. However, a small delay is likely, depending on the number of instances 
00661          * that are members of the indicated group.
00662          * 
00663          * When revoking a user/group pair permission, GroupName, SourceSecurityGroupName and 
00664          * SourceSecurityGroupOwnerId must be specified. When authorizing a CIDR IP permission, 
00665          * GroupName, IpProtocol, FromPort, ToPort and CidrIp must be specified. Mixing these two 
00666          * types of parameters is not allowed.
00667          *
00668          * @access public
00669          * @param string $group_name (Required) Name of the security group to modify.
00670          * @param array $opt Associative array of parameters which can have the following keys:
00671          * <ul>
00672          *   <li>string SourceSecurityGroupName - (Required when revoking user/group pair permission) Name of security group to authorize access to when operating on a user/group pair.</li>
00673          *   <li>string SourceSecurityGroupOwnerId - (Required when revoking user/group pair permission) Owner of security group to authorize access to when operating on a user/group pair.</li>
00674          *   <li>string IpProtocol - (Required when revoking CIDR IP permission) IP protocol to authorize access to when operating on a CIDR IP. Valid values are 'tcp', 'udp' and 'icmp'.</li>
00675          *   <li>int FromPort - (Required when revoking CIDR IP permission) Bottom of port range to authorize access to when operating on a CIDR IP. This contains the ICMP type if ICMP is being authorized.</li>
00676          *   <li>int ToPort - (Required when revoking CIDR IP permission) Top of port range to authorize access to when operating on a CIDR IP. This contains the ICMP code if ICMP is being authorized.</li>
00677          *   <li>string CidrIp - (Required when revoking CIDR IP permission) CIDR IP range to authorize access to when operating on a CIDR IP.</li>
00678          * </ul>
00679          * @return TarzanHTTPResponse
00680          * @see http://docs.amazonwebservices.com/AWSEC2/2007-03-01/DeveloperGuide/ApiReference-Query-RevokeSecurityGroupIngress.html
00681          */
00682         public function revoke_security_group_ingress($group_name, $opt = null)
00683         {
00684                 if (!$opt)
00685                 {
00686                         $opt = array();
00687                 }
00688 
00689                 if ($group_name)
00690                 {
00691                         $opt['GroupName'] = $group_name;
00692                 }
00693 
00694                 return $this->authenticate('RevokeSecurityGroupIngress', $opt, EC2_DEFAULT_URL);
00695         }
00696 }
